Major_Arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Initial Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting and main characters, establishing initial conflicts around romantic desires and the fate of Ghost Town.

sub_scenes.title: Comic Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets the stage with the title panel and an initial saloon conversation, introducing characters and themes.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town and Airport Threat
sub_scenes.description: Characters move from the saloon to a jeep, where the plan to demolish Ghost Town for an airport is revealed, creating a major conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Exit and Ghost Town Ride
Ghost Town's Past and Airport Future

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Argument and Flashback
sub_scenes.description: The emotional impact of Ghost Town's demolition is explored, including a flashback to its past, deepening the character's connection to the town.

narrative_arcs.title: Emotional Argument about Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Family and Business Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to family dynamics and business opportunities surrounding the airport construction, introducing new conflicts and tensions within Nan's family.

sub_scenes.title: Business and Family Tension
sub_scenes.description: Business discussions about the airport are juxtaposed with family disagreements, setting up conflicts related to the airport's impact.

sub_scenes.title: Horse Rental and Argument
sub_scenes.description: A new business proposition involving horse rentals leads to an escalating argument between Nan and her father, highlighting family friction.

sub_scenes.title: Humiliation and Maternal Comfort
sub_scenes.description: Nan's emotional distress after the argument is contrasted with maternal comfort and advice, exploring different perspectives on love and action.

narrative_arcs.title: Maid's Pragmatic View on Love and Action

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Commitment
sub_scenes.description: Nan seeks out Cal, leading to a horseback conversation about their relationship and commitments related to the airport deal.

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Crisis and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the emotional turmoil in Nan and Cal's relationship, leading to a reconciliation amidst external crisis.

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Plea and Dismissal
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her feelings to Cal, but is initially dismissed, leading to a sense of resignation and reflection.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Weather Warning
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile, but their personal resolution is overshadowed by the looming threat of a severe snowstorm.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Reconciliation and Understanding
Mr. Wills and Son Assess the Snowstorm's Severity
Grave Concerns about Livestock and Fodder
Confirmation of the Weather's Unprecedented Danger
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst Hardship
Cal's Ominous Reflection on Impending Starvation and Future Uncertainty

Major_Arcs.title: The Snowstorm and Salvation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the community's struggle against the snowstorm and their eventual salvation through unexpected aid.

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Hope in the Snow
sub_scenes.description: The community faces despair as the snowstorm worsens, but hope arrives in the form of an airplane dropping fodder, providing unexpected relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Doubt and Cal's Reassurance in the Face of Crisis
Nan's Mother's Plea for Rest and Hope Amidst Overwhelming Odds
Cal's Restless Night and the Unrelenting Snow
Despair and Weariness in the Face of Endless Winter
Sound of an Airplane and a Glimmer of Hope
Excitement and Realization of Fodder Drop
Conversation on Romance Amidst Crisis and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova Introduction
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline and characters, focusing on Chane Benson and his dramatic entry into a Western town.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Arrival and Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson's dramatic arrival in town is depicted, along with varied reactions from the townspeople, setting him up as a central figure.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and a Town Scene
Reactions and Judgments of Bystanders on Chane Benson's Actions
Further Reactions and Cynical Commentary on Chane Benson

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff, Sally and Clyde's Drama
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the intertwined relationships of Jeff, Sally, and Clyde, exploring family history, moral dilemmas, and romantic tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Family Concerns and Moral Contrast
sub_scenes.description: Family history and moral values are introduced as concerns about Jeff's behavior arise, contrasted with the figures of Clyde Surrett and Chane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Flashback and Concerns About Jeff
Macho Banter and Violent Undertones between Clyde and Chane

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Worry and Clyde's Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Sally's deep concern for Jeff leads to a conversation with Clyde, exploring their relationship and differing approaches to Jeff's problems.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Affectionate Agreement and Future Vision
Narrator's Observation of Jeff's Absence and Town Ride
Sally Seeks Advice from Mr. Benson
Mr. Benson's Advice on Violence and Youth

Major_Arcs.title: Newspaper Article Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around a controversial newspaper article and its immediate repercussions on relationships and community dynamics.

sub_scenes.title: Article Outrage and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: The publication of a newspaper article sparks outrage and leads to direct confrontations between Sally, Clyde (the editor), and Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Outrage Over the Article and Initial Talk with Benson
Sally Confronts Clyde, the Editor, About the Article
Clyde's Dismissive Reaction and Sally's Criticism
Sally Seeks Benson's Guidance in Juniper

Major_Arcs.title: Benson's Plan and Dinner with Chane
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Benson's plan to address the article's fallout and the unexpected dinner invitation extended to Chane Benson.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Plan and Article Fallout
sub_scenes.description: Benson reveals his plan to counter the article's effects, while Jeff and Sally discuss the article and consider inviting Chane Benson to dinner.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Reaction to the Article and Speculation on Clyde's Response
Considering Dinner with Chane and Reflecting on His Character

Major_Arcs.title: Dinner Aftermath and Confrontations
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers the tense aftermath of the dinner with Chane, leading to emotional and physical confrontations between the characters.

sub_scenes.title: Moonlight Tension and Forced Kiss
sub_scenes.description: The dinner concludes with rising tensions in the moonlight, culminating in a forced kiss and emotional outbursts.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Dinner Moonlight Conversation and Rising Tension

sub_scenes.title: Explanations and Urgent Action
sub_scenes.description: The immediate aftermath of the confrontation leads to explanations, realization of danger, and urgent action to save Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Immediate Aftermath and Explanations Following the Forced Kiss
Realization of Danger to Clyde and Urgent Need to Go to Town
Jeff's Determined Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation in Town and Jeff's Intervention

Major_Arcs.title: Town Showdown and Aftermath
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the showdown in town, its resolution, and the subsequent anxious waiting and relieved reunion.

sub_scenes.title: Showdown and Anxious Waiting
sub_scenes.description: The showdown between Chane and Clyde is arranged, followed by an anxious wait for news of the outcome inside the Clarion office.

narrative_arcs.title: Escalating Tensions and a Challenge to a Fistfight
Anxious Wait in the Clarion Office
Recounting the Night's Events and Newspaper Priority
Praise for Jeff and Clyde's Character and Family Values

Major_Arcs.title: New Ranch Boss and Range War Threat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new ranch boss, Steve Daley, and hints at potential conflicts related to ranch management and a possible range war.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Steve Daley is introduced as the new boss, amidst initial tension and concerns about ranch troubles and potential range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the New Boss, Steve Daley

sub_scenes.title: Steve Settles In and Range War Fear
sub_scenes.description: Steve settles into his role, while discussions escalate about ranch problems and the looming threat of a range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Settling Steve In and Past Doubts
Ranch Troubles and Range War Fear
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Dress Material

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve - Town Trip and Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy and Steve's trip to town and their confrontation with Fred Bridges, escalating ranch tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Town Trip and Bridges Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's town trip is interrupted by a confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, leading to a physical altercation.

Major_Arcs.title: Hank's Reprieve and Romantic Realization
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Betsy reconsider firing Hank and leads to her romantic realization about Steve, shifting from conflict to personal feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Hank Stays and Betsy's Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Betsy decides not to fire Hank, leading to her internal realization about her growing romantic feelings for Steve.

Major_Arcs.title: Romantic Confession and Commitment
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the romantic confession and commitment between Betsy and Steve, despite underlying concerns.

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and Promise
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve confess their love and commit to a relationship, with Steve promising to change for Betsy.

Major_Arcs.title: Bridges' Complaint and Steve's Past
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Old Man Bridges raise complaints about Steve, leading to a confrontation and revelations about Steve's past and intentions.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Issue and Steve's Defense
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges confronts Betsy about Steve, while Steve faces aggression from Hank and his men, leading to Steve defending himself and his past being revealed.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Hank and Steve's Defense
Justification for Arms and Recall of Ambush

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Diverging Paths
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Betsy's shift towards violence and her confrontation with Steve about his intentions, leading to their separation.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Guns and Steve's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Betsy, frustrated, decides to arm herself, leading to a confrontation with Steve about his violent intentions and his departure for Devil's Pass.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Narration of Pursuit and Arrival at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Devil's Pass and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Betsy arriving at Devil's Pass, leading to Steve's capture and a surprising romantic reassurance between them.

sub_scenes.title: Capture and Romantic Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Steve is captured at Devil's Pass, but the scene shifts to a romantic embrace with Betsy, offering a surprising moment of intimacy amidst danger.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Capture at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Dave - Relationship Drama
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Carrie's relationship drama, involving Dave and Fred, exploring romantic entanglements and ranch business.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy, Dave, and Ranch Issues
sub_scenes.description: Betsy (corrected to Carrie as per context) confronts Dave, while ranch issues and Curley's behavior become apparent.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Behavior and Ranch Concerns

sub_scenes.title: Fence Conflict and Mediation
sub_scenes.description: A fence dispute escalates into confrontation, with Curley attempting to mediate but raising suspicion.

sub_scenes.title: Apology and Fred Discussion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie and Dave reconcile, followed by a discussion about Fred and differing opinions, leading to a tense encounter with Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion of Fred and Differing Opinions
Agreement to Avoid Conflict and Carrie's Reflection
Encounter with Fred Gordon and Ominous Question

Major_Arcs.title: Miss Bronson, Mr. Gordon and Carrie's Choice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon, and culminates in Carrie making a significant romantic decision.

sub_scenes.title: Bronson & Gordon and Movie Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon are introduced, followed by Carrie and Dave reconciling and Fred proposing marriage to Carrie.

narrative_arcs.title: Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon's Conversation about Dave's Feelings

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Contract Deception and Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc reveals Fred's deception about the Carlton contract and Carrie's explosive reaction and confrontation.

sub_scenes.title: Contract Deception and Fury
sub_scenes.description: Fred's deception regarding the Carlton contract is exposed, leading to Carrie's furious confrontation and rejection.

Major_Arcs.title: Carlton Office Confrontation and Emotional Fallout
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Carrie's confrontation in Carlton's office and the emotional aftermath, including seeking comfort from her father.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office and Father's Comfort
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton, followed by emotional breakdown and seeking comfort from her father after the intense confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Assertions in Carlton's Office

Major_Arcs.title: Separation and Misunderstanding with Dave
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers Carrie's separation from Fred and her emotionally charged encounter with Dave, marked by misunderstanding and past wisdom.

sub_scenes.title: Separation with Dave and Father's Wisdom
sub_scenes.description: Carrie separates from Fred and then encounters Dave, leading to a tense conversation and reflection on her father's insights.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Pride and Present Hurt with Fred
Unexpected Encounter and Cold Dismissal in Town
Concern and Defiance in the Buckboard

Major_Arcs.title: Reconciliation with Fred
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc sees Carrie reconcile with Fred after understanding the truth about the Carlton contract, leading to a romantic reunion.

sub_scenes.title: Doctor's Advice and Fred's Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie, influenced by a doctor's advice and Dave's confession, seeks out Fred, leading to reconciliation and a romantic climax.

narrative_arcs.title: Father and Dave's Clarification & Carlton's Interjection
Dave's Confession and Carrie's Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Dirk - Escape and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chris and Dirk's storyline, focusing on Dirk's injury, escape, and betrayal by Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Arrival and Injury
sub_scenes.description: Dirk, injured, seeks help from Chris, revealing his gunshot wound and initiating their escape plan.

narrative_arcs.title: Late Night Visitor and Urgent Plea

sub_scenes.title: Family Concern and Marshal's Inquiry
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's family expresses concern, while the Marshal begins his inquiry, leading to a confrontation with Chris.

narrative_arcs.title: Worried Kin and a Father's Decision

Major_Arcs.title: Marshal's Dilemma and Chris's Decision
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the Marshal's interrogation and Chris's plea for mercy, leading to a shift in their dynamic and Chris making a crucial decision.

sub_scenes.title: Marshal's Interrogation and Plea for Mercy
sub_scenes.description: The Marshal interrogates Chris and Dirk, but Chris's plea for mercy leads to a change of plans and a more personal interaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Mercy and a Change of Plans

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Rance - Love and Duty
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the developing romantic relationship between Chris and Rance, set against the backdrop of duty and Dirk's situation.

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Embrace, and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance confess their love and embrace, but duty and Dirk's escape plan soon take center stage.

narrative_arcs.title: Duty vs. Love and a Hint of Escape
Decision to Act and Arming Dirk

Major_Arcs.title: Escape, Gunfight, and Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details Dirk's escape attempt, the ensuing gunfight with the Marshal, and the shocking betrayal by Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and his companion initiate their escape but are immediately pursued, leading to a desperate evasion attempt.

sub_scenes.title: Abandonment and Deception Revealed
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris abandon Rance, but Chris returns, only to discover Rance's deception about his injury and Dirk's escape.

Major_Arcs.title: Rance's Recovery and Wedding
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc concludes the story with Rance's recovery, his and Chris's reunion, and their wedding, resolving the central romantic and conflict threads.

sub_scenes.title: Recovery and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Rance recovers, leading to a heartfelt reunion with Chris and a marriage proposal, marking a positive turning point.

sub_scenes.title: Pre-Wedding and Ceremony Interruption
sub_scenes.description: Pre-wedding reflections and preparations are followed by the wedding ceremony itself, which is dramatically interrupted by Dirk.
